GLM_GTX_rotate_normalized_axis
[GTC Extensions (Stable)]

Collaboration diagram for GLM_GTX_rotate_normalized_axis:
Quaternions and matrices rotations around normalized axis. More...

template<typename T, precision P>

< T, P > 		glm::rotateNormalizedAxis (detail::tmat4x4< T, P > const &m, T const &angle, detail::tvec3< T, P > const &axis)
template<typename T, precision P>
GLM_FUNC_DECL detail::tquat< T, P > glm::rotateNormalizedAxis (detail::tquat< T, P > const &q, T const &angle, detail::tvec3< T, P > const &axis)

Detailed Description

Quaternions and matrices rotations around normalized axis.

<glm/gtx/rotate_normalized_axis.hpp> need to be included to use these functionalities.

Function Documentation

template<typename T, precision P>
GLM_FUNC_QUALIFIER detail::tquat< T, P > glm::rotateNormalizedAxis ( detail::tquat< T, P > const &  q,
T const &  angle,
detail::tvec3< T, P > const &  axis 
) [inline]

Rotates a quaternion from a vector of 3 components normalized axis and an angle.

Parameters:
q Source orientation
angle Angle expressed in radians if GLM_FORCE_RADIANS is define or degrees otherwise.
axis Normalized axis of the rotation, must be normalized.
See also:
GLM_GTX_rotate_normalized_axis

References glm::cos(), glm::radians(), and glm::sin().

00080         {
00081                 detail::tvec3<T, P> Tmp = v;
00082 
00083 #ifdef GLM_FORCE_RADIANS
00084                 T const AngleRad(angle);
00085 #else
00086 #               pragma message("GLM: rotateNormalizedAxis function taking degrees as parameters is deprecated. #define GLM_FORCE_RADIANS before including GLM headers to remove this message.")
00087                 T const AngleRad = radians(angle);
00088 #endif
00089                 T const Sin = sin(AngleRad * T(0.5));
00090 
00091                 return q * detail::tquat<T, P>(cos(AngleRad * static_cast<T>(0.5)), Tmp.x * Sin, Tmp.y * Sin, Tmp.z * Sin);

template<typename T, precision P>
GLM_FUNC_QUALIFIER detail::tmat4x4< T, P > glm::rotateNormalizedAxis ( detail::tmat4x4< T, P > const &  m,
T const &  angle,
detail::tvec3< T, P > const &  axis 
) [inline]

Builds a rotation 4 * 4 matrix created from a normalized axis and an angle.

Parameters:
m Input matrix multiplied by this rotation matrix.
angle Rotation angle expressed in radians if GLM_FORCE_RADIANS is define or degrees otherwise.
axis Rotation axis, must be normalized.
Template Parameters:
T Value type used to build the matrix. Currently supported: half (not recommanded), float or double.
See also:
GLM_GTX_rotate_normalized_axis

- rotate(T angle, T x, T y, T z)

- rotate(detail::tmat4x4<T, P> const & m, T angle, T x, T y, T z)

- rotate(T angle, detail::tvec3<T, P> const & v)

References glm::axis(), glm::cos(), glm::radians(), and glm::sin().

00038         {
00039 #ifdef GLM_FORCE_RADIANS
00040                 T a = angle;
00041 #else
00042 #               pragma message("GLM: rotateNormalizedAxis function taking degrees as parameters is deprecated. #define GLM_FORCE_RADIANS before including GLM headers to remove this message.")
00043                 T a = radians(angle);
00044 #endif
00045                 T c = cos(a);
00046                 T s = sin(a);
00047 
00048                 detail::tvec3<T, P> axis = v;
00049 
00050                 detail::tvec3<T, P> temp = (T(1) - c) * axis;
00051 
00052                 detail::tmat4x4<T, P> Rotate(detail::tmat4x4<T, P>::_null);
00053                 Rotate[0][0] = c + temp[0] * axis[0];
00054                 Rotate[0][1] = 0 + temp[0] * axis[1] + s * axis[2];
00055                 Rotate[0][2] = 0 + temp[0] * axis[2] - s * axis[1];
00056 
00057                 Rotate[1][0] = 0 + temp[1] * axis[0] - s * axis[2];
00058                 Rotate[1][1] = c + temp[1] * axis[1];
00059                 Rotate[1][2] = 0 + temp[1] * axis[2] + s * axis[0];
00060 
00061                 Rotate[2][0] = 0 + temp[2] * axis[0] + s * axis[1];
00062                 Rotate[2][1] = 0 + temp[2] * axis[1] - s * axis[0];
00063                 Rotate[2][2] = c + temp[2] * axis[2];
00064 
00065                 detail::tmat4x4<T, P> Result(detail::tmat4x4<T, P>::_null);
00066                 Result[0] = m[0] * Rotate[0][0] + m[1] * Rotate[0][1] + m[2] * Rotate[0][2];
00067                 Result[1] = m[0] * Rotate[1][0] + m[1] * Rotate[1][1] + m[2] * Rotate[1][2];
00068                 Result[2] = m[0] * Rotate[2][0] + m[1] * Rotate[2][1] + m[2] * Rotate[2][2];
00069                 Result[3] = m[3];
00070                 return Result;
00071         }
